INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Ventricular assistance devices (VAD) are centrifugal pumps used to replace (partially or completely) a sick ventricle of patients that are waiting a heart transplant. There are studies asserting that some patients that used a VAD while were waiting for a heart transplant were healed because the load reduction over the heart let it recover and strengthen, so the patients didn't need a surgery anymore. However, some problems are related to its use like the calcification of the aortic valve (that remains underused due to the bypass induced by the VAD). Several papers have been published proposing control techniques for the motor which actuates the VAD. In general, these works seek to improve the physiological characteristics of the control. Some of these techniques use vital signals, like the electrocardiogram (ECG), the arterial pressure and the cardiac output to make the VAD operates according to the physiological demands of the patient. In this context, this work intends to generate the velocity reference to a VAD from the ECG, observing if this velocity signal lets the aortic valve open what would avoid its calcification. The QRS complexes of the ECG will be detected by digital signal processing and they will be used to fit a sawtooth wave to the velocity reference of the motor. The validation of this proposal will be done with mathematical models of the cardiovascular system and of the VAD. The system will be implemented physically with the Hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) simulation. The ECG signals utilized in this work were extracted from the physiological signals database Physionet.
